Package com.ibm.streams.operator.management

Interface OperatorContextMXBean

public interface OperatorContextMXBean
The management bean for a Java operator's context. OperatorMXBean exposes information about the operator, its context and notifications related to its life cycle. Within the processing element (PE) an OperatorContextMXBean represents each Java operator executing within the PE. The management bean is automatically registered with the platform MBeanServer before Operator.initialize(OperatorContext) is called.
An operator may unregister its management bean from the platform MBeanServer if required. Unregistering will cause all management beans for the operator to be unregistered (for example any MetricMXBean that have been registered for the operator. The management bean is unregistered automatically once Operator.shutdown() completes.

The ObjectName for uniquely identifying the MXBean for an operator within the PE in the platform MBean server is:
com.ibm.streams.operator:type=operatorcontext,name=operator_name
where operator_name is the value returned by OperatorContext.getName() and getName()

Notifications
OperatorContextMXBean is a NotificationEmitter that emits notifications related to the operator's life cycle.

  • ALL_PORTS_READY - Notification the operator's ports are ready and it is free to submit tuples. The notification's userData will be null.
  • SHUTDOWN - Notification the operator is to be shutdown.
  • SHUTDOWN_COMPLETE - Notification the operator has completed its shutdown. The notification's userData will be null.
  • CUSTOM_METRIC_CREATED - Notification the operator has created a custom metric. The notification's userData will be the name of the custom metric.
Since:
InfoSphere® Streams Version 3.0
See Also:
  • OperatorManagement.STREAMS_OPERATOR_JMX_DOMAIN
  • OperatorManagement.Type.OPERATORCONTEXT

    • ALL_PORTS_READY

      static final String ALL_PORTS_READY
      Notification the operator's ports are ready and it is free to submit tuples.
      The notification's userData will be null.
      The value of this notification identifier is "com.ibm.streams.operator.lifecycle.allPortsReady".
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SHUTDOWN

      static final String SHUTDOWN
      Notification the operator is to be shutdown.
      The notification's userData will be null.
      The value of this notification identifier is "com.ibm.streams.operator.lifecycle.shutdown.notify".
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SHUTDOWN_COMPLETE

      static final String SHUTDOWN_COMPLETE
      Notification the operator has completed its shutdown by returning from its Operator.shutdown() method.
      The notification's userData will be null.
      The value of this notification identifier is "com.ibm.streams.operator.lifecycle.shutdown.complete".

    • CUSTOM_METRIC_CREATED

      static final String CUSTOM_METRIC_CREATED
      Notification the operator has created a custom metric.
      The notification's userData will be the name of the newly created Metric.
      The value of this notification identifier is "com.ibm.streams.operator.metric.createCustom".
      See Also:
      • OperatorMetrics.createCustomMetric(String, String, com.ibm.streams.operator.metrics.Metric.Kind)
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Get the name of the operator.

      The operator name is unique across the application. For operators in a parallel region, the name includes the channel they are in.

      Returns:
      the name of the operator.
      See Also:
      • getLogicalName()
      • OperatorContext.getName()

    • getImplementationClassName

      String getImplementationClassName()
      Get the Java class name implementing the operator
      Returns:
      Class name implementing Operator.

    • getThreadIds

      long[] getThreadIds()
      Return the current set of thread identifiers for live threads created by this operator's ThreadFactory. The returned identifiers may be used with the platform ThreadMXBean to analyze then operator's background threads. Some threads included in the returned array may have been terminated when this method returns.
      See Also:
      • OperatorContext.getThreadFactory()

    • registerCustomMetric

      ObjectName registerCustomMetric(String name)
      Register a MetricMXBean for a custom metric. The custom metric must already exist.

      The ObjectName for uniquely identifying the metric's MXBean in the platform MBean server is:
      com.ibm.streams.operator:type=metric,metric=custom,name=metric_name,operator=operator_name
      where:

      • metric_name is the name of the metric, passed in as name
      • operator_name is the value returned by OperatorContext.getName() and getName()

      Parameters:
      name - Name of the custom metric to have a MetricMXBean registered in the platform MBeanServer.
      Returns:
      Object name for the registered MetricMXBean.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - The custom metric does not exist.
      See Also:
      • OperatorMetrics.getCustomMetric(String)

    • registerInputPortMetrics

      void registerInputPortMetrics(int port)
      Register an MetricMXBean for all valid metrics for the operator input port at index port. MetricMXBean for input port queue related metrics are only registered if the input port is queued (OperatorMetrics.InputPortMetric.queueSize metric is not zero).
      The ObjectName for uniquely identifying any input port metric's MXBean in the platform MBean server is:
      com.ibm.streams.operator:type=metric,metric=operatorInputPort,port=port_index,name=metric_name,operator=operator_name
      where:
      • port_index is the index of the input port (from port)
      • metric_name is the name of the metric from Enum.name()
      • operator_name is the value returned by OperatorContext.getName() and getName()

      Parameters:
      port - Index of input port.

    • registerOutputPortMetrics

      void registerOutputPortMetrics(int port)
      Register an MetricMXBean for all metrics for the operator output port at index port.
      The ObjectName for uniquely identifying any output port metric's MXBean in the platform MBean server is:
      com.ibm.streams.operator:type=metric,metric=operatorOutputPort,port=port_index,name=metric_name,operator=operator_name
      where:
      • port_index is the index of the input port (from port)
      • metric_name is the name of the metric from Enum.name()
      • operator_name is the value returned by OperatorContext.getName() and getName()

      Parameters:
      port - Index of output port.

    • isAllPortsReady

      boolean isAllPortsReady()
      Has the operator been notified of port readiness.
      Returns:
      True if the operator been notified of port readiness, false otherwise.
      Since:
      InfoSphere® Streams Version 3.2
      See Also:
      • Operator.allPortsReady()
      • Port readiness notification

    • isShutdown

      boolean isShutdown()
      Has the operator been notified of shutdown..
      Returns:
      True if the operator has been notified of shutdown, false otherwise.
      Since:
      InfoSphere® Streams Version 3.2
      See Also:
      • Operator.shutdown()
      • Shutdown notification

    • getChannel

      int getChannel()
      Get the index of the parallel channel the operator is in.

      If the operator is in a parallel region, this method returns a value from 0 to N-1, where N is the number of channels in the parallel region; otherwise it returns -1.

      Returns:
      the index of the parallel channel this operator is in, if the operator is in a parallel region, or -1 if the operator is not in a parallel region.
      Since:
      InfoSphere® Streams Version 3.2
      See Also:
      • OperatorContext.getChannel()

    • getLocalChannel

      int getLocalChannel()
      Get the index of the parallel channel in the most immediate parallel region the operator is in.

      If the operator is in a parallel region, this method returns a value from 0 to N-1, where N is the number of channels in the parallel region; otherwise it returns -1.

      Returns:
      the index of the parallel channel this operator is in, if the operator is in a parallel region, or -1 if the operator is not in a parallel region.
      Since:
      IBM Streams Version 4.2
      See Also:
      • OperatorContext.getLocalChannel()

    • getMaxChannels

      int getMaxChannels()
      Get the total number of parallel channels for the parallel region that the operator is in. If the operator is not in a parallel region, this method returns 0.
      Returns:
      the number of parallel channels for the parallel region that this operator is in, or 0 if the operator is not in a parallel region.
      Since:
      InfoSphere® Streams Version 3.2
      See Also:
      • OperatorContext.getMaxChannels()

    • getLocalMaxChannels

      int getLocalMaxChannels()
      Get the total number of parallel channels for the most immediate parallel region that the operator is in. If the operator is not in a parallel region, this method returns 0.
      Returns:
      the number of parallel channels for the parallel region that this operator is in, or 0 if the operator is not in a parallel region.
      Since:
      IBM Streams Version 4.2
      See Also:
      • OperatorContext.getLocalMaxChannels()

    • getLogicalName

      String getLogicalName()
      Get the logical name of the operator.
      Returns:
      the logical name of the operator.
      Since:
      InfoSphere® Streams Version 3.2
      See Also:
      • OperatorContext.getLogicalName()
